Original Text: I would be extremely careful and vigilant about the accuracy of any information posted on the site. There's no denying that the information added to the site would not be systematically checked by a human translator. However, this carries the risk of displaying information with translations that lack subtleties or cultural nuances that only a human translator would be able to identify, understand and translate into another EU language without distorting the meaning of the original message. While machine translation undoubtedly contributes to streamlining and speeding up the publication of public data, I believe there is an increased risk of distorting the meaning of messages. Translations may be too vague or too broad. This would risk multiplying the interpretations that official information would receive across the EU. This would not only undermine public confidence in the EU institutions, but also threaten the coherence of official EU positions and diplomacy between Member States. In conclusion, I sincerely believe that translation should not be 100% machine translation, regardless of the nature of the content being translated. The stakes are too high to risk mistranslation and misinterpretation of official messages.
Translated in English: I would be extremely careful and vigilant about the accuracy of any information posted on the site. There's no denying that the information added to the site would not be systematically checked by a human translator. However, this carries the risk of displaying information with translations that lack subtleties or cultural nuances that only a human translator would be able to identify, understand and translate into another EU language without distorting the meaning of the original message. While machine translation undoubtedly contributes to streamlining and speeding up the publication of public data, I believe there is an increased risk of distorting the meaning of messages. Translations may be too vague or too broad. This would risk multiplying the interpretations that official information would receive across the EU. This would not only undermine public confidence in the EU institutions, but also threaten the coherence of official EU positions and diplomacy between Member States. In conclusion, I sincerely believe that translation should not be 100% machine translation, regardless of the nature of the content being translated. The stakes are too high to risk mistranslation and misinterpretation of official messages.

Original Text: Nonostante la traduzione automatizzata possa essere considerata uno strumento utile perché propone una soluzione immediata, non riuscirà mai a sostituire il lavoro specializzato di un traduttore. Questo perché la traduzione termine per termine che produce la traduzione automatizzata non sempre ricrea delle frasi di senso compiuto, è sempre necessario che ci sia una revisione da parte di un essere umano che rilegga e sistemi lo scritto. Vi consiglio di preferire sempre dei traduttori specializzati ai programmi di traduzione automatica se volete avere un sito web che contenga contenuti di alto livello scritti in maniera appropriata per tutti i cittadini dell'Unione Europea. In un mondo ideale sarebbe fantastico se ogni cittadino potesse accedere alle informazioni di cui ha bisogno nella lingua del suo Paese, senza incappare in strafalcioni o errori di sintassi o grammatica dati dall'utilizzo della traduzione automatizzata.
Translated in English: Although the automated translation can be considered a useful tool because it proposes an immediate solution, it will never be able to replace the specialized work of a translator. This is because the term translation by term that produces the automated translation does not always recreate the phrases of complete meaning, it is always necessary that there is a review by a human being who reread and systems the writing. I recommend that you always prefer specialized translators to automatic translation programs if you want to have a website that contains high -level content written appropriately for all citizens of the European Union. In an ideal world it would be fantastic if every citizen could access the information he needs in the language of his country, without running into blunders or syntax errors or grammar given by the use of automated translation.

Original Text: Om webbplatsen endast översätts av maskiner skulle det eventuellt minska riktigheten i texten på webbplatsen, vilket skulle göra mig mer kritisk till innehållet. Det kommer exempelvis vara svårt att kontrollera alla sidor om de faktiskt är en korrekt översatt text eller om översättningen har blivit felaktig. Ett exempel på detta är att människor har möjlighet att sätta sig in i ett sammanhang och förstå "den egentliga" meningen med en text, något som en maskin kan ha svårt att göra, en människa kan "läsa mellan raderna" medan en maskin bokstavligt översätter ord för ord, vilket i sig kan bli väldigt fel. Den mänskliga faktorn i detta är en positiv del då människan har förståelse för kulturella- och geopolitiska faktorer som en maskin kan missa. Med detta sagt så möjliggör maskinöversättning att fler sidor på webbplatsen kan översättas till alla EU-språk snabbare och öka användarbarheten samt representationen för fler EU-medborgare. Tillgängligheten skulle öka. Jag tror inte på att man enbart ska fokusera på att översätta webbplatsen med maskinöversättning, dock tror jag att maskinöversättning kan vara till stor hjälp för människor att utföra översättningen av webbplatsen.
Translated in English: If the site is only translated by machines, it would possibly reduce the accuracy of the text on the site, which would make me more critical of the content. For example, it will be difficult to check all pages if they are actually a properly translated text or if the translation has become incorrect. An example of this is that people have the opportunity to get into a context and understand "the actual" meaning of a text, something that a machine may have difficulty doing, a human being can "read between the lines" while a machine literally translates Words for words, which in itself can be very wrong. The human factor in this is a positive part as man has an understanding of cultural and geopolitical factors that a machine can miss. That being said, machine translation enables more pages on the site to be translated into all EU languages ​​faster and increase userability and representation for more EU citizens. Accessibility would increase. I do not believe that you should focus solely on translating the site with machine translation, however, I think that machine translation can be of great help to people to carry out the translation of the site.
